member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.Helpers.Toggle(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},System.Boolean)
member.summary: This provides a toggle based on boolean input. Replacement for Rhythm.Toggle.

member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.Helpers.ThisOrThat(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},System.Boolean)
member.summary: This provides a toggle input to select between 2 inputs.
member.param: True for option 1, false for option 2.

member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.ImportExport.ScreenshotMainWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a full screenshot of the main window.

member.name: T:Rhythm.Helpers.System
member.summary: Wrapper class for system stuff

member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.System.CurrentUserTempFolder(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This returns the temporary path for the current user.
member.param: Optional toggle to refresh the node

member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.System.CurrentUserAppData(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This returns the appdata path for the current user.
member.param: Optional toggle to refresh the node

member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.System.CurrentUserDomainName(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the domain name of the current user.
member.param: Optional toggle to refresh the node

member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.System.SendToClipboard(System.String)
member.summary: Send the given string to the clipboard

member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.System.CurrentUserName(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the current windows user.
member.param: Optional toggle to refresh the node

member.name: M:Rhythm.Helpers.System.JiggleMouse(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: This will move your mouse back and forth slowly while periodic run is on.
member.param: True will cause the mouse to move on it's own.

member.name: T:Rhythm.Numbers.Numbers
member.summary: Wrapper class for numbers

member.name: M:Rhythm.Numbers.Numbers.ToWords(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Convert the input numbers into words. Only considers whole numbers (integers). Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.param: This offers the option to override the locale of the words. By default it uses your computer's locale, you can override this with the list here. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-lcid/a9eac961-e77d-41a6-90a5-ce1a8b0cdb9c?redirectedfrom=MSDN

member.name: M:Rhythm.Numbers.Numbers.ToOrdinalWords(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Convert the input numbers into ordinal words. Only considers whole numbers (integers) (Eg. 1 becomes 1st). Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.param: This offers the option to override the locale of the words. By default it uses your computer's locale, you can override this with the list here. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-lcid/a9eac961-e77d-41a6-90a5-ce1a8b0cdb9c?redirectedfrom=MSDN

member.name: M:Rhythm.Numbers.Numbers.ToHeading(System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Convert the input numbers into headings: N,S,E,W or north, east, south or west. Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)

member.name: M:Rhythm.Numbers.Numbers.ToHeadingArrow(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert the input numbers into headings: ‚Üë, ‚Üí, ‚Üì, ‚Üê. Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)

member.name: T:Rhythm.String.Modify
member.summary: Wrapper class for string modifiers

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.ToTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the input string to a title case.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.ToQuantity(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This will attempt to return a quantity, given a string and count. Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.param: The string to convert to quantity.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Truncate(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: This will truncate the given string, byt the given length. (Eg."Long text to truncate", with 10, becomes Long text‚Ä¶") Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.param: The target length of the string.
The characters to fill in the string with.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Pluralize(System.String)
member.summary: This will attempt to return a plural version of a word. Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.returns: The string in it's plural form.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Singularize(System.String)
member.summary: This will attempt to return a singular version of a word. Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.returns: The string in it's singular form.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Titleize(System.String)
member.summary: Titleize converts the input words to Title casing Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.returns: The string in it's title form.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Pascalize(System.String)
member.summary: Pascalize converts the input words to UpperCamelCase, also removing underscores and spaces. (Eg. SomeTitleForSomething) Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.returns: The string in it's pascal case form.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Camelize(System.String)
member.summary: Camelize behaves identically to Pascalize, except that the first character is lower case. (Eg. someTitleForSomething) Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.returns: The string in it's camel case form.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Underscore(System.String)
member.summary: Underscore separates the input words with underscore. (Eg. some_title) Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.param: The string to convert to underscore separated.
member.returns: The resulting words separated with underscores.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Dasherize(System.String)
member.summary: Underscore separates the input words with a dash. (Eg. Some-Title) Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.param: The string to convert to dash separated.
member.returns: The resulting words separated with dashes.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.Humanize(System.Object)
member.summary: Humanize string extensions allow you turn an otherwise computerized string into a more readable human-friendly one. "Underscored_input_string_is_turned_into_sentence." becomes "Underscored input string is turned into sentence" Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)
member.param: The string to human understandable form.

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.FormatWith(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Format input string with arguments. Made possible with Humanizer (https://github.com/Humanizr/Humanizer)

member.name: M:Rhythm.String.Modify.MOcKtExt(System.String)
member.summary: This generates a "mocking text" case. Just for fun. üòÄ
